movie_title: Follow This Example Today (And Every Day)
introduction: ✉️ Want Stoic wisdom delivered to your inbox daily? Sign up for the FREE Daily Stoic email at https:

vocabulary.definition: a person who seeks wisdom or enlightenment through intellectual study and reasoning
vocabulary.example: Socrates is known as a great philosopher in ancient Greece.

vocabulary.definition: causing disagreement or argument, especially among a large number of people
vocabulary.example: The new policy proved to be controversial among the employees.

vocabulary.definition: difficulties or misfortune; a situation of serious or continued difficulty
vocabulary.example: She showed great resilience in the face of adversity.

vocabulary.definition: to make someone or something famous and remembered forever
vocabulary.example: His heroic actions were immortalized in a series of paintings.

vocabulary.definition: mutually opposed or inconsistent; containing elements that are inconsistent with each other
vocabulary.example: His statements on the matter were contradictory and confusing.

vocabulary.definition: the ability to control oneself and make oneself work hard or behave in a particular way without needing anyone else to tell you what to do
vocabulary.example: Athletes need a high level of self-discipline to maintain their training regimen.
